class firemon_api.apps.policyplanner.packets.Packets(api: ~firemon_api.core.api.FiremonAPI, app: ~firemon_api.core.app.App, wf_id: int, record=<class 'firemon_api.apps.policyplanner.packets.Packet'>)¶

Bases: Endpoint

Represents the Packets/Tickets endpoint

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

Keyword Arguments:

record (obj) – default Record object

all() → list[Packet]¶

Get all Record

create(config: dict | None = None) → Packet¶

Create a workflow packet/ticket instance

Keyword Arguments:

config (dict) –

ep_name = 'packet'¶
filter(*args, **kwargs) → list[Packet]¶

Attempt to use the filter options. Really only a single query

Parameters:

  • *args – arbitrary args. only the first with update the kwargs siql

  • **kwargs – arbitary kwargs for siql

get(*args, **kwargs) → Packet | None¶

Get single Record

Parameters:

  • *args (int) – (optional) id to retrieve. If this is not type(int) dump it into filter and grind it up there.

  • **kwargs (str) – (optional) see filter() for available filters

Examples

Get by ID

>>> fm.sm.centralsyslogs.get(12)
new york

Get by partial name. Case insensative.

>>> fm.sm.centralsyslogs.get(name='detro')
detroit

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
